Case reference: 2010000599.CaseDesc: Bradley Allan Taylor was on his way home to Enfield, Nova Scotia from London, Ontario. He spent the night in Brockville, Ontario at the Travelodge Motel.  On January 10, 2009, he left the motel in the morning and later that day police found his car abandoned near a railway crossing in Roussillon, Quebec. Many of his personal belongings were found in the car. Police searched the area but Mr. Taylor was not located.

Hair: Brown, Long, Straight, Beard, Moustache, Sideburns

Case reference: 2014005935.CaseDesc: On December 4, 2012, Lucien Bélanger left his residence near the Saint-François River in Drummondville, Quebec. He had made suicidal comments and was despondent at the time of the events.

Case reference: 2014001247.CaseDesc: On July 3, 1989, Henry and his brother, William Gerbrand, were fishing in a canoe on Codette Lake near Nipawin, SK. At approximately 8:00 p.m., boaters heard calls for help. It is suspected that both men drowned; divers were unable to find them.

Case reference: 2014001540.CaseDesc: Marie Laliberté was a resident of east Vancouver who was engaged in a high risk lifestyle. She was last seen by her resource worker on January 1, 1997. Due to her increasingly sporadic contact with family and a lack of social interaction with others, she was not reported missing until March 8, 2002.

Case reference: 2014002963.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1990, Nicholas Leonard was seen for the last time rowing a homemade kayak towards the north end of Lower Loon Lake in the town of Wabush, Newfoundland.

Case reference: 2020008533.CaseDesc: On January 15, 1982, at approximately 7:30 am, Jona Rashid was last seen near 2275 Weston Road in Toronto, Ontario. Jona had called his sister in law at 5:30pm and stated that he would be coming over for dinner.

Case reference: 2014004920.CaseDesc: On May 1, 2004 William "Bruce" Molaski left his residence in Toronto, Ontario, in a maroon pick-up truck. A few days later, police found Mr. Molaski's truck at 16 Regatta Road in Toronto.

Case reference: 2012001399.CaseDesc: On December 27, 2011, a male was found washed up on the shore of Wolfe Island in Lake Ontario. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He is thought to have been in the water for months to years. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts that this unidentified male is of either European ancestry, or Middle Eastern/North African ancestry or Mixed ancestry of European and Middle Eastern/North African ancestry.

Teeth: many absent teeth and several composite restorations in upper and lower teeth.
Deformity: Torso (Back), advanced arthritis of the spine

Case reference: 2005003999.CaseDesc: On December 19, 1990, a Caucasian male was found on a park bench at George Brown College near 147 Baldwin Avenue, Toronto. This male may have been a smoker. His appendix is present and he has a left-sided hernia of the diaphragm.

Hair: Brown, Short, grey beard and moustache
Money: Copper, Several pennies were found in his pocket.
Boots: Brown, vinyl ankle boot with side zipper
Mark: Right Leg, small ulcers and bruises
Left Leg, small ulcers and bruises
Amputation: Left Ring Finger, missing the tip

Case reference: 2012020185.CaseDesc: Remains of this adult male were located on the shore of Lake Kamloops, approximately 19 kilometers west of Kamloops.

Teeth: False, Had no teeth. Only a lower denture was recovered which had dark brown stain, likely tobacco.
Pants: Other, Off-white, Canvas full length pants

Case reference: 2009003699.CaseDesc: Michel Gagich, who typically goes by his middle name: Steve, was last seen by his father on Saturday, September 5, 2009 at his residence in Hamilton.  He left his residence on Sunday, September 6, 2009 in the morning, around 8:00 a.m. without speaking to his parents.  He left a note indicating that he was leaving for the weekend. Mr. Gagich's vehicle was located on Tuesday, September 8, 2009 at approximately 7:15 p.m. when a passing airplane observed a fire.  By the time the fire department arrived the vehicle was completely burned.  The vehicle was located in a remote area on Emmett Lake Road in St. Edmund's Township.  Mr. Gagich was last seen at the Tobermory Ferry Terminal on Wednesday, September 9, 2009 at 7 a.m.  It is not known if he purchased a ticket to board the ferry.  The MS Chi Cheemaun ferry provides transportation for vehicles and people from Tobermory to South Baymouth on Manitoulin Island.

Hair: Brown, Short, Dark, receding hair line; Moustache, Sideburns

Case reference: 2012020154.CaseDesc: This female was recovered from the Burrard Inlet, approximately 200 feet from the wharf at Versatile Pacific Shipyards.

Gloves: Synthetic, White, White dress gloves in pocket

Case reference: 2019062090.CaseDesc: On October 26, 2019, Maysa Nouasri was last seen with her father, Larbi Nouasri, in the borough of Saint-Léonard in Montreal, Quebec. It is believed that the two have travelled to Algeria, without Maysa’s mother’s consent.

Case reference: 2006011199.CaseDesc: On May 9, 1986, Gregory Beaumont left the Silver Lake Campground by boat to fish on the lake. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2012030001.CaseDesc: In April 2011, both parents took their son, Aleksander to visit the mother's family in Poland. The father came back to Canada on his own on May 13, 2011. The mother, Elzbieta Nowacki and child did not return to Canada.

Case reference: 2008003299.CaseDesc: On May 17, 1985, Cyril Cheong was fishing on White Lake with his friends when the weather deteriorated and strong winds started to blow. Mr. Cheong's boat capsized and his friends were unable to save him.  One of his friends saw him, approximately 2 to 3 feet under the water, beyond his reach.

Case reference: 2008018099.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1974, at approximately 8:15 hours, Douglas Henderson and Alexander Korecki were canoeing in a 14 foot fiberglass canoe close to the shore in the area of Depot Harbor, Big Sound, in Georgian Bay. The canoe capsized approximately 500 feet away from the campsite.

Case reference: 2014002472.CaseDesc: In April 1988, Stacey Rogers was seen for the last time as she left her residence in Taylor, British Columbia. Stacey had stated that she was planning on travelling to Edmonton, Alberta, but did not go to Edmonton. It is possible that she went to Grande Prairie, Alberta.

Case reference: 2013000145.CaseDesc: The Calgary Police Service is seeking the public's assistance in locating Ralph Simington. He was last seen in Calgary, Alberta on June 15, 2012.

Case reference: 2014001057.CaseDesc: On October 10, 1989, the body of a man, possibly originating from Romania was discovered in a skylight of a condominium building. According to experts the man had bodily injuries resulting from a very high fall.

Socks: Wool, Beige, for left foot only
Pants: Wool, Brown, Black, size 30; made in Poland

Case reference: 2020011412.CaseDesc: On July 10, 1985, at approximately 11:00pm, Tahiya Shiekh was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Tahiya had been having ongoing disputes with her parents.

Case reference: 2008002499.CaseDesc: On August 21, 1983, three men were doing some repairs to a dock at the cottage when they heard a male voice shouting "Help" three times approximately 5 seconds apart. All three witnesses observed a boat turning in circles. Two of the men ran to their boat and went to the out-of-control boat. They found the boat unattended. They were unable to locate the victim, Robert Kennedy. The boat ran ashore and Mr. Kennedy has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2012020165.CaseDesc: The remains of this male were found in a forested area immediately north of the Port Coquitlam cemetery.

Teeth: Visible Decay, Missing an upper front tooth on the left side prior to death. The upper front tooth on the right side was angled.
Deformity: Left Knee, Osgoode-Schlatter's disease - bony bump on shin below knee

Case reference: 2014001301.CaseDesc: On September 11, 1999, Harold Donald Maskell was reported missing by his cousin Mike Viger. Harold’s cousin had come to visit him at his residence in Coles Island, New Brunswick, but there was no sign of him at the house. A search of the shoreline of the Canaan River returned negative results. Harold does not drive and cannot walk very far.

Shirt: Red, Plaid, Plaid; red, white, blue

Case reference: 2005005799.CaseDesc: October 8, 1978, the body of an unidentified man was found floating in Hamilton Bay near the Skyway Bridge. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 140-150 lbs and his length was measured at 5'4"-5'6", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He is thought to have been in the water for months to years.

Teeth: His upper right central incisor has a silicate/resin restoration.

Case reference: 2020011563.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1988, at approximately 12:00pm, Mosses Korman was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001116.CaseDesc: On November 5, 1992, the skeletal remains of a man were found near Parksville on the Englishman River in British Colombia. The man had extensive dental restorations and may have been American. He recently had surgery for ingrown toenails, on both feet, and had a healed fracture to the left collarbone, which was repaired with a surgical wire. It is estimated that he may have died several months earlier.

Shirt: Other, T-Shirt, Brand Royal Comfort, size 42-44
Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Wristwatch, Casio
Shoes: White, Grey, Runners, Brand Brooks, blue striped
Fractured/Broken Bones: Chest, Healed rib and clavicle fracture
Foreign Object: Chest, Stainless steel wire in the left clavicle

Case reference: 2016060952.CaseDesc: On October 2, 2016, Gaétan Roy was seen for the last time at his residence in Quebec City, Quebec. He left with a considerable amount of his personal effects and without saying where he was going. His credit cards were last used on October 6, 2016, in the Calgary, Alberta area. Gaétan is known to be despondent and he is familiar with western Canada and National Parks.

Mark: Left Forearm, Burn on the lower part
Right Forearm, Burn on the lower part

Case reference: 2014004448.CaseDesc: Carmelo Tomasino was last seen on January 19, 2004 in Montreal. His absence and not calling home is out of character.

Tattoo: Chest, Hearts with the names Amanda and Brenda

Case reference: 2016068711.CaseDesc: On September 30, 1969, an unidentified male was found 0.8 kilometres west of Sioux Lookout. His death appears to be self-inflicted

Case reference: 2014006135.CaseDesc: In December 2012, Victor Pedtchenko was last seen in the area of 55 Triller Avenue in Toronto, Ontario. Victor had not been seen for one month before being reported missing.

Case reference: 2014005298.CaseDesc: On June 13, 2009, Hatice Corbacioglu was last seen leaving her residence in Toronto, Ontario.  Hatice was bound for New York State, in the USA.

Case reference: 2018067156.CaseDesc: On November 27, 2018, Courtney James was seen for the last time on security camera footage in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004511.CaseDesc: On July 29, 2004 George Davis left a residence near Creston, BC to get cigarettes. He was driving a 1981 brown Chrysler Lebaron with a British Columbia licence plate. The vehicle has not been recovered.

Mark: Eyes, Mole lower lid right eye

Case reference: 2014006304.CaseDesc: Richard Gaida left his hometown of Martensville, Saskatchewan for Kelowna, British Columbia at the end of September, 2012.  Richard was in the Kelowna area to work, however, Richard has not been seen or heard from since September, 2012 when he was last in contact with family and co-workers.

Case reference: 2014006290.CaseDesc: Roxanne Marie Isadore was reported missing by a family member on September 24, 2013.  She had been out of family contact since she moved to Edmonton from Valleyview in 2006. Her last confirmed whereabouts were in Edmonton, in June of 2008.  She was known to live in the area of, and to frequent, 118 Ave in the Beverly neighbourhood of Edmonton, AB.

Case reference: 2014001578.CaseDesc: Benjamin ARSENAULT went missing from 172 Sydney St, Saint John, NB (Rooming House). He was wearing a grey suit coat.

Case reference: 2006012599.CaseDesc: Ralph Grant was last seen in the Huntsville area between January 28 and February 22, 1999. He resided on Yearly Road, Huntsville.

Amputation: Lower jaw surgically removed due to cancer

Case reference: 2020008364.CaseDesc: On December 19, 1982, at approximately 10:30 am, Simon Yefronovich was seen for the last time by his friend as he left his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Simon was scheduled to fly to Vancouver, British Columbia, with his friend, but he never boarded the flight.

Case reference: 2014001607.CaseDesc: On August 4, 1979, Joseph Cohen was seen for the last time in Montreal. It was a Saturday night, he was out with friends at the Blanche Neige restaurant located in Côte-des-Neiges. His vehicle was located in a parking lot facing Valois Road.

Case reference: 2013000121.CaseDesc: On October 13, 2012, human remains were located near Cochrane, Alberta. The Calgary Medical Examiner has determined that the remains are those of a white man between the ages of 20 and 60 years old.  The remains had been decomposing for less than a year prior to being discovered.  This man had once suffered a broken nose that had healed.

Case reference: 2014001023.CaseDesc: On August 3, 1998, the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Fraser River in Delta, British Columbia. The man’s body was found in the south end of the Fraser Surrey Docks Ltd and it is estimated that he may have possibly died between October 1997 and April 1998.

Jewelry: Wood, Brown, Black, Necklace, 1.5" Cross on cord
Shirt: Cloth, Black, Blue, T Shirt, Brand Bugle Boy
Jacket: Cloth, Tan, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Winter, Down filled, purple inside
Pants: Denim, Blue, IKEDA, Brand Marks & Spencer
Shoes: Canvas, Black, White, Running, Brand Reebok, size 9

Case reference: 2021056657.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1990, skeletal remains were recovered from a lobster trap off the coast of Bay Roberts in Newfoundland and Labrador.

Case reference: 2018053572.CaseDesc: On February 15, 1996, Maymuna Mohamid was seen for the last time by her brother and sister-in-law in Toronto, Ontario. When her brother returned home, Maymuna and all her personal belongings were gone.

Case reference: 2014001143.CaseDesc: The remains of a male were found on July 14, 1979 floating in the Peace River about 16 kms north of the town of Peace River. It is estimated this individual died between 8 and 10 months prior to recovery. There was extensive dental work present.

Case reference: 2017013508.CaseDesc: On March 26, 1989, the remains of a man were found in Fish Creek Park in Calgary, Alberta. The individual was missing four front teeth and may have worn a partial upper denture. Extensive dental work is present.

Case reference: 2014005209.CaseDesc: On June 30, 1990, at approximately 10:15am, Cindy Clair was seen for the last time near 25 Martha Eaton Way in Toronto, Ontario. Ms. Clair told her roommate she was going for a walk and never returned.

Case reference: 2012020653.CaseDesc: On May 12, 2003, Patsy Haysom was last seen when she was dropped off at the back of her residence by a friend.

Shoes: Red, Blue, BUM Equipment Logo, Slip on

Case reference: 2008006299.CaseDesc: On September 30, 1960, Willie Ray was reported missing. He had left his residence approximately 3 weeks earlier. It was common for him to go hunting and fishing.  Mr. Ray was reportedly very comfortable living in the outdoors and could sustain himself for quite sometime. There was a 12 gauge shotgun missing from the Ray residence. The boats frequently used by Mr. Ray were all accounted for.

Case reference: 2015015784.CaseDesc: Richele Bear was reported missing to the Regina Police Service on September 5, 2013. She was last seen on August 9, 2013 leaving a residence in the 900 block of Rae Street. She is believed to live a high risk lifestyle.

Scar: Left Upper Arm, A round inoculation scar (10mm)

Case reference: 2014003135.CaseDesc: On March 28, 1986, Herman Yahyahkeekoot was last seen at his residence, a farm which was a group home.  Mr. Yahyahkeekoot had a history of wandering away from the home. The location is close to the Nesbit Forest which was searched, however, he was never located.

Case reference: 2014001430.CaseDesc: On July 28, 1980, Robert Wiggins was last seen in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2020010632.CaseDesc: April Parisian was last seen at Yale, British Columbia, on or about March 28, 2021. April has not been seen or heard since.

Case reference: 2020051730.CaseDesc: On Dec 10, 2020, Gurpreet Singh Parmar was last seen on a video surveillance camera walking away from his family residence in Abbotsford, British Columbia.  Gurpreet has not been seen or heard from since.

Backpack: Other, Lunch bag or Lunch pail with shoulder strap
Hat: Other, Possibly wearing a brimmed hat
Pants: Other, Possibly wearing dark pants or sweatpants
Sweater: Other, Dark coloured sweater, hoodie or jacket, possibly red

Case reference: 2014006326.CaseDesc: Ronald Kay was reported missing to the Regina Police Service on November 26, 2013. He was last seen at the Saskatchewan Rough Riders Football game and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 1986087920.CaseDesc: On July 30, 1985, Nicole Morin was seen for the last time leaving her apartment in Toronto, Ontario. Nicole had made arrangements to meet her friend in the lobby of their building so they could go swimming in the pool located at the rear of the building. Nicole never appeared in the lobby. Despite an intense search at the time, Nicole has not been found.

Mark: Forehead, Small birthmark on upper right side of forehead

Case reference: 2014003815.CaseDesc: Monica Cardinal was reported missing to the Edmonton Police Service in February, 1997. Monica was last seen leaving a downtown hotel with an unknown male in June, 1993.

Case reference: 2014006050.CaseDesc: On April 3, 2013, Mr. Patrice Mathieu was reported missing from his home in St-Joseph-de-Sorel. He was last seen the day before. Mr. Mathieu does not own a car, however he does have a driver's licence. Mr. Mathieu usually travels on foot. He is quiet and is, by nature, anxious and withdrawn.

Coat: Black, Mid-thigh length with a hood

Case reference: 2014001575.CaseDesc: On March 12, 1983, Samuel Amos Quatell was reported missing from the fishing vessel “ISE II”, near Steep Island, BC. Steep Island is located near Seymour Narrows; between Quadra Island and Campbell River, BC. Samuel was last seen near the rear of the vessel, by the ship’s crew.  An extensive search failed to locate Samuel. The tidal currents near the island are extremely strong and any person in the water could travel a great distance in a short period of time.

Amputation: Left Hand, Missing tip of ring finger

Case reference: 2014005523.CaseDesc: In 1998, Chi Fong was seen for the last time by his mother in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2021055837.CaseDesc: On December 1, 2021, Raheem White was seen for the last time in the Osler Street and Pelham Avenue area in Toronto, Ontario

Tattoo: Left Arm, Palm tree inside left bicep
Shoulders, Rose on left and right shoulders

Case reference: 2014006419.CaseDesc: On January 23, 2014, Ally Hassan Mabruki was seen for the last time at one of Toronto's Refugee Intake Shelters in Ontario. Staff members overheard Ally stating he was going to visit his lawyer regarding his refugee claim.

Case reference: 2019062920.CaseDesc: In 1975, Louise Laderoute was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. During the time of her disappearance, Louise had been residing at her parents’ home and it is believed that she went missing after leaving their residence.

Scar: Left Cheek, Facial scar from the cheek to the corner of the mouth.

Case reference: 2013000048.CaseDesc: On May 26, 2002, Mendes Joseph was seen for the last time at his apartment located in the Montréal-Nord district of Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014005629.CaseDesc: On June 23, 2011, Yoo Heo was seen for the last time at a Youth Centre in Toronto, Ontario. At the time of her disappearance, Yoo had recently arrived to Canada from Korea.

Case reference: 2014001970.CaseDesc: On December 20, 1996, Wayne Hansen was seen for the last time as he checked himself out of a hospital in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014005958.CaseDesc: Dallas Broich was last seen at his residence in Edmonton, Alberta, on October 8, 2012. He was supposed to report for work in Fort McMurray, Alberta, the following day but never arrived. Dallas has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004543.CaseDesc: Marguerite Cardwell was last seen in Calgary, AB on Sept. 10, 1973, when she told a friend that she was planning on travelling to either Edmonton or Vancouver. Her vehicle was found near Canmore, AB on Sept. 16, 1973. Her purse and other personal belongings were found inside the vehicle.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Ankle, 2 inch screw in ankle

Case reference: 2016059837.CaseDesc: On December 6, 2001, a male was found in the Detroit River, near 4200 block on Sandwich Street. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 138 lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been in the water a few days to a few months.

Hair: Short curly black hair on the left side of face
Teeth: Full gold crown on the lower left second molar
Jewelry: Braided, unknown if anklet or bracelet
Gold, Ears, Clear stone stud earrings
Ring: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Right Little Finger, 2 rings
Shirt: Black, Hooded sweatshirt with "Providence Friars" written on the front
Shorts: Blue, Gold, "Champion" brand short with the "University of Michigan" logo

Case reference: 2017015824.CaseDesc: On March 24, 2017, Hua Guo was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001848.CaseDesc: Laurie Baier was seen for the last time on April 27, 1977. Her vehicle was subsequently found abandoned on a forest road in Matagami, Quebec.

Case reference: 2006004799.CaseDesc: Ralph Monague and Curtis Smith were passengers on the Christian Island Ferry travelling between Cedar Point and Christian Island on December 22, 1985, when they fell over board in stormy conditions.

Case reference: 2014002535.CaseDesc: Ginette Landry was seen for the last time in Montreal on April 15, 1994. Ms. Landry would often travel for missions to help people in need.

Case reference: 2021048123.CaseDesc: On September 16, 2021, an unidentified man was discovered near 35 Carl Hall road in Toronto, Ontario.

Purse: Black, Black pouch with white edging, zippered, and on a clip
Pants: Denim, Black, Blue, Brand: Guess, jeans
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Small Toe, 5th toe on the left foot
Left Chest, Healed fracture on the left side ribs 10,11 and 12
Right Chest, Healed fracture of right ribs 11 and 12

Case reference: 2016066833.CaseDesc: On April 26, 1982, an unidentified male was discovered in the Detroit River, near Fighting Island. His post-mortem length was estimated as being between 5'6"-5'8",  however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated he was in the water for no more than 6 months.

Jacket: Parka or hooded jacket, which had both a zipper and snap fasteners

Case reference: 2014005921.CaseDesc: On June 19, 2012, at approximately noon, Diane Bonneau was seen for the last time at her residence in Saint-Félicien, Quebec. Diane hasn’t been seen and we haven’t heard from her since.

Case reference: 2014002360.CaseDesc: On August 25, 1996, Benoit Lachance was seen for the last time in the Pointes-Aux-Trembles District in Montreal, Quebec. Benoit was a member of a motorcycle club called the "Rowdy Crew" and drove a blue Chevrolet Camaro.

Scar: Middle Back, Bullet still in the back

Case reference: 2015011664.CaseDesc: On July 6, 1994, the body of an adult male believed to be between the ages of 25-35 was found in the waters of the St. Lawrence River near the Old Port of Montreal Clock Tower in Montreal, Quebec.

Sweater: Cotton, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Fruit of the Loom brand, T-shirt with short sleeves, faded, size medium
Scar: Right Hand, 2.4 cm at the base of the thumb

Case reference: 2014005520.CaseDesc: On November 20, 2010, at approximately 5:00 p.m., Dina Bat-Og was seen for the last time leaving her home to go to work in Toronto, Ontario. Dina had advised that she would be returning home at midnight, but never returned.

Case reference: 2012020009.CaseDesc: Kathleen Wattley was last seen on June 13, 1992. It is unusual for Kathleen not to return home to her children. Kathleen was known to live a high risk life style.

Case reference: 2008002399.CaseDesc: David Manuel Hannah was last seen in Kingston, Ontario, on January 4, 1983. Mr. Hannah was employed as a prison guard at Millhaven Maximum Security Penitentiary in Kingston. His vehicle, a 1969 blue Delta 88, with Ontario licence plate SYM 921 has not been located.

Case reference: 2016008385.CaseDesc: On December 18, 2015, Destiny Kazibwe was last seen at her school in Brampton.  It is believed that on February 18, 2016, Destiny's mother Rosemarie Tumusiime and father Robert Kazibwe, travelled from Brampton to Kabale, Uganda with their twin children Destiny and Adam.  Further investigation has not been able to confirm the well-being of Destiny or of her brother Adam.

Case reference: 2006020499.CaseDesc: Theodore Piekarz was initially reported missing in 1978. Piekarz was planning a trip to British Columbia. He was seen at the Kirkland Lake Train Station in October 1986. Mr. Piekarz may suffer from mental health issues, including suicidal tendencies.

Mark: Nose, mole on the right side of his nose

Case reference: 2014005330.CaseDesc: On September 13, 2009, at approximately 6:30 a.m., Rose Mackinnon was seen for the last time when she left the Earnestine Women’s shelter with her two children. Rose advised that she would be returning but has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2020040348.CaseDesc: Muriel Jones was seen for the last time in 1959 in Toronto, Ontario. Muriel had indicated that she was intending on traveling to the West.

Case reference: 2014005302.CaseDesc: On November 11, 2005, in Toronto, Canada, Zaina Trujillo-Talib was abducted by her father, Chaudhry Talib and her paternal grandmother, Shama Talib.  Chaudhry and Shama immediately took six-year-old Zaina to their family home located in Lahore, Pakistan.  Since this time, Zaina's mother has not been allowed to have any contact with her daughter.

Case reference: 2021048330.CaseDesc: On July 12, 2015, at approximately 7 :00 a.m., Dan Ingram was seen for the last time as he slipped and fell into the water near the Whirlpool State Park in Niagara Falls, New York.

Scar: Left Forearm, From wrist to elbow

Case reference: 2014005200.CaseDesc: Conrad Hastings was last seen at the bus shelter at Smith Street and Portage Avenue.  His whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014001767.CaseDesc: On October 15, 1991, Mario Chouinard was seen for the last time while hunting on the Zec Festubert(controlled harvesting zone) located in the municipality of Clovas in the Abitibi-Témiscamingue region of Quebec. Mario has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003404.CaseDesc: Armand Comtois was reported missing on May 2, 1985. At the time of his disappearance he was living in Saint-Hyacinthe, Quebec. He was seen by a family member on March 9, 1985 but he has not been seen or heard from since this date. He also used the name of "Simon".

Teeth: Dental appliance, partial composed of 4 upper teeth.

Case reference: 2017055687.CaseDesc: On April 17, 2017, Ryan Mead was seen for the last time leaving his family residence in Brampton, Ontario to travel to British Columbia. Mr. Mead purchased camping equipment in Medicine Hat, Alberta in May of 2017. Some of his possessions were recovered along the South Saskatchewan River in late May.

Case reference: 2012020037.CaseDesc: Mr. Old Shoes' last known whereabouts are that he was camping on the Blood Reserve Timber limits area located between Waterton Lakes National Park and the Chief Mountain Border Crossing. He was last seen on April 1, 2001.

Case reference: 2018033880.CaseDesc: On February 2, 2005, Quang Le was seen for the last time by his landlord in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2015059939.CaseDesc: On October 20, 1973, the remains of a male were recovered from the water near the Fleet Street Pumping Station, Ottawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being between 170-180lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  It is estimated that he had been in the water between 2 and 3 months.

Case reference: 2012020097.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1986, Corrine Moosomin, 25 years old, was last seen at approximately 4:00 a.m. on the Saulteaux First Nation near North Battleford, SK. She was last seen walking on a grid road. Corrine was reported missing and extensive searches failed to locate her.

Case reference: 2012020012.CaseDesc: Jeffrey Surtel was last seen April 28, 2007 at his residence in Mission, BC. Jeff is believed to have left his home riding a distinctive blue CCM mountain bike with yellow forks.

Case reference: 2016069642.CaseDesc: On April 21, 1995, the remains of a woman were discovered near Carbon, Alberta. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be between 10 and 15 years. The individual had dental restorations including stainless steel crowns.

Case reference: 2014003678.CaseDesc: On June 21, 1960, Donald McKillop's wife reported him missing to the Police. The last time she spoke to her husband was on June 19. She was working away from the home and returned on the June 20 to find her husband away.   Mr. McKillop's wife indicated to police she had spoken to her husband and he had not indicated he was leaving for any reason. Donald McKillop left the home without his wallet, there was no clothing missing and all his carpentry tools were present. Inquiries with family and friends revealed nothing else. Mr. McKillop had no history of mental disorder or suicidal tendencies.  There is no indication of foul play in his disappearance.

Case reference: 2012020169.CaseDesc: On May 14, 1995, the skeletal remains of a man were found in the water at the Reed Point Marina in Port Moody, British Columbia. The man had significant osteoarthritis in his neck and back. He may have been from Alberta and is estimated to have died more than a year prior to discovery.

Teeth: Visible Missing, This male was missing a number of teeth and likely wore a partial upper dental plate prior to death.
Socks: Cotton, White, Sport, Blue and red stripes

Case reference: 2006014699.CaseDesc: On September 28, 1996, at approximately 2:00 a.m., Melanie Ethier was seen for the last time as she left a friend’s residence to walk to her residence in New Liskeard, Ontario. The distance between her home and her friend’s residence was a kilometre, but Melanie never arrived home. Foul play is suspected.

Shirt: Cotton, White, a blue heart ("Pepe" logo) t-shirt
